summary: Prior to the Chief Financial Officers Act of 1990, government reports found that agencies lost billions of dollars through fraud, waste, abuse, and mismanagement. This painted a picture of a government unable to properly manage programs or effectively provide services. The Act sought to address these problems with comprehensive federal financial management reform. Among other things, it established CFO positions, provided for long-range planning, and...
title: Federal Financial Management: Substantial Progress Made since the CFO Act of 1990 and Preliminary Observations on Opportunities for Enhancement
topics: Consolidated Financial Statements of the U.S. Government
